intro: Gaultheria weberbaueriana, commonly known as the Andean wintergreen, is a species of shrub native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many evergreen and deciduous shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. Its berries, which are edible, are often used in traditional medicine for their aromatic and stimulant properties. Gaultheria weberbaueriana thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests and alpine meadows.
